thread.title: Dubai's June inflation falls back from six-year high
thread.title_full: Dubai's June inflation falls back from six-year high

title: Dubai's June inflation falls back from six-year high
text:
Dubai's June inflation falls back from six-year high Article By Staff writer Tuesday, 14 July 2015 1:48 PM 
Dubai's inflation rate in June fell from six-year highs in the previous month despite another large jump in housing and utility costs, according to consumer price data released by Dubai Statistics Centre on Sunday. 
Inflation fell from 4.7 percent year-on-year in May to 4.2 percent last month with housing and utility costs, which account for almost 44 percent of consumer expenses, soaring 7.7 percent from a year earlier. 
Food and beverage prices, which account for 11 percent of the basket, rose by 1.7 percent on an annual basis, according to the figures which were cited by Reuters. 
Dubai and Abu Dhabi have been ranked as the 23rd and 33rd most expensive cities to live in, according to Mercer’s 2015 Cost of Living Survey published last week. 
The two cities have experienced a significant jump compared to 2014, with Dubai soaring 44 places from last year’s position at 67 and Abu Dhabi going up 35 places 68th in 2014. 
Steep increases for expatriate rental accommodations in both cities partly drove this rise up the list, Mercer said.
